member.name: T:KMHoldable
member.summary: Interface to define a holdable object that can be picked up by motion controls Should add a rigidbody or a default one will be created

member.name: F:KMHoldable.targetPosition
member.summary: Position to hold object when picked up

member.name: F:KMHoldable.targetRotation
member.summary: Default rotation of object when held

member.name: T:KMHoldable.ButtonEnum

member.name: T:KMHoldable.AxisEnum
member.summary: Enumeration of controller axes

member.name: T:KMHoldable.HoldableAvailabilityEnum
member.summary: Enumeration of holdable availibilities

member.summary: Indicates in which room the holdable will be available

member.summary: Get a specified axis value for the controller holding this object

member.summary: Get whether a specified button is currently held for the controller holding this object

member.summary: Gets the transform for the anchor on the controller holding this object

member.name: T:KMHoldable.KMOnGetAxisValueDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for checking axis value

member.summary: Delegate type for checking buttonup event

member.name: T:KMMaterialInfo
member.summary: This component is added during assetbundle build to any game objects that have material components This should not be used by modders but is instead used to mitigate potential future incompatibilities in Unity

member.name: F:KMMaterialInfo.ShaderNames
member.summary: The name of the shader used by the material on this game object

member.name: T:KMComponentPool
member.summary: A ComponentPool is a collection of Module Types. The generator will pick Count times from this list and instantiate a component of the chosen type.

member.name: T:KMComponentPool.ComponentSource
member.summary: Controls where this pool will draw from (e.g. the base game modules, modules from mods, or both).

member.name: T:KMComponentPool.SpecialComponentTypeEnum
member.summary: Controls whether the modules will be chosen dynamically at runtime from whatever modules are loaded (based on the ComponentSource). Set to "None" to select specific module types.

member.name: T:KMComponentPool.ComponentTypeEnum
member.summary: The module types in the base game.

member.name: F:KMComponentPool.Count
member.summary: How many components from this pool should be selected.

member.name: F:KMComponentPool.AllowedSources
member.summary: Controls where components can come from (either the base game, mods, or both).

member.name: F:KMComponentPool.ComponentTypes
member.summary: The list of component types, not including any calculated at runtime special types, like ALL_SOLVABLE. Use GetComponentTypes to get the calculated list.

member.name: F:KMComponentPool.SpecialComponentType
member.summary: Special types which are calculated at runtime, such as ALL_SOLVABLE.

member.name: F:KMComponentPool.ModTypes
member.summary: A list of mod types to be included in the pool, if they exist.

member.name: T:KMGeneratorSetting
member.summary: Everything needed to generate a single bomb.

member.name: F:KMGeneratorSetting.TimeLimit
member.summary: Initial value for the timer when the bomb is activated, in seconds.

member.name: F:KMGeneratorSetting.NumStrikes
member.summary: The number of strikes at which the bomb explodes. Hardcore is 1. More forgiving is 3.

member.name: F:KMGeneratorSetting.TimeBeforeNeedyActivation
member.summary: Time, in seconds, which must elapse before any unactivated Needy modules are automatically activated.

member.name: F:KMGeneratorSetting.FrontFaceOnly
member.summary: Force modules to be placed only on the front face. By default this will limit the module count to 5 (+1 for the timer). Useful in rare circumstances where you wish to generate a bomb with a few modules and guarantee that they will all be visibile simultaneously.

member.name: F:KMGeneratorSetting.OptionalWidgetCount
member.summary: Set how many optional widgets (widgets other than serial number) that should be placed on the bomb

member.name: F:KMGeneratorSetting.ComponentPools
member.summary: The pools of modules that will be used when generating a bomb.

member.name: M:KMGeneratorSetting.GetComponentCount
member.returns: The total count of modules that will be added according to the component pools.

member.name: T:KMMission
member.summary: Meta-data describing everything for a mission.

member.name: P:KMMission.ID
member.summary: Unique identifier for this mission.

member.name: F:KMMission.DisplayName
member.summary: The mission name as it appears in the bomb binder.

member.name: F:KMMission.Description
member.summary: The description shown in the bomb binder.

member.name: F:KMMission.GeneratorSetting
member.summary: Details about how the bomb should be generated for this mission.

member.name: F:KMMission.PacingEventsEnabled
member.summary: Controls whether or not all pacing events are enabled.

member.name: T:KMMissionTableOfContents
member.summary: Meta-data that controls how custom missions are listed in the bomb binder.

member.name: T:KMMissionTableOfContents.Section
member.summary: Describes a list of missions along with an appropriate header.

member.name: F:KMMissionTableOfContents.Section.Title
member.summary: The section header used in the bomb binder. Example: "Challenging", "Exotic".

member.name: F:KMMissionTableOfContents.Section.MissionIDs
member.summary: Custom missions from this mod to be included in the section.

member.name: F:KMMissionTableOfContents.Title
member.summary: Title of the entire table of contents. Example: "Gary's Missions".

member.name: F:KMMissionTableOfContents.Sections
member.summary: An ordered list of sections to include in the bomb binder.

member.name: T:KMNeedyModule
member.summary: This class acts as a proxy for the game's needy bomb module. Don't subclass but instead add it as a component.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.CountdownTime
member.summary: The amount of time on the needy timer whenever this module is activated.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.ModuleType
member.summary: The identifier for the module as referenced in missions. e.g. "BigButton"

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.ModuleDisplayName
member.summary: The nice display name shown to players. e.g. "The Button"

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.RequiresTimerVisibility
member.summary: Set to true to only allow this module to be placed on the same face as the timer. Useful when the rules involve the timer in some way (like the Big Button), but should be used sparingly as it limits generation possibilities.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.WarnAtFiveSeconds
member.summary: Set to true if you want the needy module to make audio warnings when time goes below 5 seconds

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.OnNeedyActivation
member.summary: Do not have your needy module start counting down until this activation happens.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.OnNeedyDeactivation
member.summary: This is usually when the bomb has been solved or has exploded. You will need to stop your countdown.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.OnTimerExpired
member.summary: Handle when timer runs out, usually by giving a strike.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.OnActivate
member.summary: Event is fired when the bomb has been activated and the timer has started.

member.name: M:KMNeedyModule.HandlePass
member.summary: Call this when the needy module has been correctly satisified and should be temporarily put to rest.

member.name: M:KMNeedyModule.HandleStrike
member.summary: Call this on any mistake that you want to cause a bomb strike.

member.name: M:KMNeedyModule.GetRuleGenerationSeed
member.summary: Returns the random seed used to generate the rules for this game. Not currently used.

member.name: M:KMNeedyModule.SetNeedyTimeRemaining(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the time remaining, this will have no effect if timer isn't active

member.name: M:KMNeedyModule.GetNeedyTimeRemaining
member.summary: Gets the time remaining, this will return -1f if not active

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.OnStrike
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to hook into the bomb.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.OnPass
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to hook into the bomb.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.GetRuleGenerationSeedHandler
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to hook into the bomb.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.GetNeedyTimeRemainingHandler
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to hook into the bomb.

member.name: F:KMNeedyModule.SetNeedyTimeRemainingHandler
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to hook into the bomb.

member.name: T:KMWidget
member.summary: A proxy for the game's Widget class, which is a non-interactive, but queryable, element that can be added around the bombs. Don't subclass but instead add it as a component. E.g. serial number, indicator light, ports.

member.name: F:KMWidget.SizeX
member.summary: The horizontal size of the widget. Usually 1 or 2 units.

member.name: F:KMWidget.SizeZ
member.summary: The vertical size of the widget. Usually 1 or 2 units.

member.name: T:KMAudio
member.summary: Component that provides an interface to the game's audio system. Allows playing of sounds in a way that will respect volume settings and gameplay events. Can be used to play existing sounds or sounds added in this mod.

member.name: M:KMAudio.PlaySoundAtTransform(System.String,UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Play a sound from this mod at the given transform.

member.name: M:KMAudio.PlayGameSoundAtTransform(KMSoundOverride.SoundEffect,UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Play an existing game sound (or its override) at the given transform.

member.name: M:KMAudio.PlaySoundAtTransformWithRef(System.String,UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Play a sound from this mod at the given transform.
member.returns: A KMAudioRef that can be used to stop sounds early

member.name: M:KMAudio.PlayGameSoundAtTransformWithRef(KMSoundOverride.SoundEffect,UnityEngine.Transform)
member.summary: Play an existing game sound (or its override) at the given transform.
member.returns: A KMAudioRef that can be used to stop sounds early

member.name: T:KMBomb
member.summary: Component representing the bomb visual, including the faces upon which modules are placed as well as the areas for spawning widgets.

member.name: T:KMBombFace
member.summary: A collection of transforms where modules can be instantiated along with their backings.

member.name: F:KMBombFace.Anchors
member.summary: Module spawn points.

member.name: F:KMBombFace.TimerAnchors
member.summary: The set of anchors that can be used for the timer All anchors in TimerAnchors must also be in the Anchors list If not TimerAnchors are found a random Anchor from the Anchors list will be chosen

member.name: F:KMBombFace.Backings
member.summary: Visual models of the backing (e.g. foam) spawned behind modules, in the same order as Anchors.

member.name: T:KMBombInfo
member.summary: Interface to information about the bomb and its widgets. Add this component to a module to query properties of the bomb for use in rules.

member.name: M:KMBombInfo.GetTime
member.returns: Time remaining on the bomb, in seconds.

member.name: M:KMBombInfo.GetFormattedTime
member.summary: Get the text currently displayed on the bomb's timer.

member.name: M:KMBombInfo.GetStrikes
member.returns: The number of strikes received by the player this round.

member.name: M:KMBombInfo.GetModuleNames
member.returns: A list of the module names on the current bomb.

member.name: M:KMBombInfo.GetSolvableModuleNames
member.returns: A list of the solvable module names on the current bomb.

member.name: M:KMBombInfo.GetSolvedModuleNames
member.returns: A list of the solved module names on the current bomb.

member.name: M:KMBombInfo.QueryWidgets(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Query all widgets on the bomb using the given queryKey. Use this to get information about things like battery count, indicator labels, or custom information from mod widgets.
Be sure to consider all responses when using this information in your rules, as there may be more than one instance of a widget and thus more than one valid response.
member.returns: A list of response strings from all widgets.

member.name: M:KMBombInfo.IsBombPresent
member.returns: True if there is a bomb present. This will not be the case during non-gameplay scenes.

member.name: T:KMBombModule
member.summary: This class acts as a proxy for the game's needy bomb module. Don't subclass but instead add it as a component.

member.name: F:KMBombModule.ModuleType
member.summary: The identifier for the module as referenced in missions. e.g. "BigButton"

member.name: F:KMBombModule.ModuleDisplayName
member.summary: The nice display name shown to players. e.g. "The Button"

member.name: F:KMBombModule.RequiresTimerVisibility
member.summary: Set to true to only allow this module to be placed on the same face as the timer. Useful when the rules involve the timer in some way (like the Big Button), but should be used sparingly as it limits generation possibilities.

member.name: F:KMBombModule.OnActivate
member.summary: Event is fired when the bomb has been activated and the timer has started.

member.name: M:KMBombModule.HandlePass

member.name: M:KMBombModule.HandleStrike
member.summary: Call this on any mistake that you want to cause a bomb strike.

member.name: M:KMBombModule.GetRuleGenerationSeed
member.summary: Returns the random seed used to generate the rules for this game. Not currently used.

member.name: T:KMGameCommands
member.summary: Interface to directly execute actions related to the game or controlling game flow.

member.name: M:KMGameCommands.StartMission(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Launches a mission using the given mission id as well as the random seed provided. Useful for triggering deterministic rounds (e.g. for a tournament).

member.name: M:KMGameCommands.StartMission(KMMission,System.String)
member.summary: Launches a custom KMMission with the mission id set to 'custom'

member.name: M:KMGameCommands.CauseStrike(System.String)
member.summary: Cause a strike on the bomb for whatever reason you deem is appropriate.

member.name: M:KMGameCommands.GetBombs
member.summary: Gets the list of all bombs currently available

member.name: M:KMGameCommands.CreateBomb(System.String,KMGeneratorSetting,UnityEngine.GameObject,System.String)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new bomb with
member.param: The mission id to spawn the bomb based on
Generator seetings that will be used if missionId is empty or null
A gameobject whose transform will determine where the bomb spawns
The seed used to generate the bomb, currently this must parse to an int

member.name: M:KMGameCommands.RemoveSolvedBomb(KMBomb)
member.summary: Attempts to remove a solved bomb from play, may fail if bomb not found or only one bomb remaining and not freeplay mode

member.name: T:KMGameCommands.KMStartMissionCommand
member.summary: Delegate type starting mission with id

member.name: T:KMGameCommands.KMStartCustomMissionCommand
member.summary: Delegate type starting mission with custom settings

member.name: T:KMGameCommands.KMCauseStrikeDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type causing a strike

member.name: T:KMGameCommands.GetBombsDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for getting the list of all bombs

member.name: T:KMGameCommands.CreateBombDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for creating a bomb

member.name: T:KMGameCommands.RemoveSolvedBombDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for removing a bomb

member.name: F:KMGameCommands.OnStartMission
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to start a mission.

member.name: F:KMGameCommands.OnStartCustomMission
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to start a mission.

member.name: F:KMGameCommands.OnCauseStrike
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to cause a strike.

member.name: F:KMGameCommands.OnGetBombs
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to retrieve the list of bombs

member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to create a bomb

member.name: F:KMGameCommands.OnRemoveSolvedBomb

member.name: T:KMGameInfo
member.summary: Interface to get information about game and to get notified of game state changes.

member.name: T:KMGameInfo.State
member.summary: An enumeration of game states

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.State.Gameplay
member.summary: The gameplay state where defusing happens

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.State.Setup
member.summary: The setup state in the office where options are chosen

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.State.PostGame
member.summary: The state where results are shown

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.State.Transitioning
member.summary: No current state, transitioning to a new state

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.State.Unlock
member.summary: The unlock state where manual verification and tutorial take place

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.State.Quitting
member.summary: Game is exiting

member.name: T:KMGameInfo.KMModuleInfo
member.summary: A structure that contains a module's name and ID

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.KMModuleInfo.DisplayName
member.summary: The display name of the module

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.KMModuleInfo.ModuleId
member.summary: The id of the module

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.KMModuleInfo.IsMod
member.summary: True if this module is from a mod rather from the game

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.KMModuleInfo.IsNeedy
member.summary: True if this module is needy and cannot be solved

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.KMModuleInfo.ModuleType
member.summary: Returns the module type of built in modules or empty if this is a mod module

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.OnStateChange
member.summary: Called when game state changes between gameplay, setup, postgame and loading

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.OnAlarmClockChange
member.summary: Called when alarm clock turns on or off

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.OnLightsChange
member.summary: Called when in game lights change state

member.name: M:KMGameInfo.GetAvailableModuleInfo
member.summary: Gets information about all available modules that could be used in a bomb
member.returns: A list of information about available bomb modules

member.name: M:KMGameInfo.GetMaximumBombModules
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of bomb modules that can be placed based on which cases are available
member.returns: The maximum number of bomb modules that can be placed

member.name: M:KMGameInfo.GetMaximumModulesFrontFace
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of bomb modules that can be placed based on which cases are available and only front face is available
member.returns: The maximum number of bomb modules that can be placed on the front face of any bomb

member.name: T:KMGameInfo.KMStateChangeDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for state changes

member.name: T:KMGameInfo.KMAlarmClockChangeDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for alarm clock state change

member.name: T:KMGameInfo.KMLightsChangeDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for change in lights

member.name: T:KMGameInfo.KMGetAvailableModuleInfoDelgate
member.summary: Delegate type for getting info on available modules

member.name: T:KMGameInfo.KMGetMaximumBombModulesDelgate
member.summary: Delegate type for getting the total number of modules that can be placed

member.name: T:KMGameInfo.KMGetMaximumModulesFrontFaceDelgate
member.summary: Delegate type for getting the total number of modules that can be placed on a front face

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.OnGetAvailableModuleInfo
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to get available module info

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.OnGetMaximumBombModules
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game for getting the total number of modules that can be placed

member.name: F:KMGameInfo.OnGetMaximumModulesFrontFace
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game for getting the total number of modules that can be placed on a front face

member.name: T:KMGameplayRoom
member.summary: Add this component to a prefab to allow it to be used as a room during gameplay (i.e. bomb defusal).

member.name: F:KMGameplayRoom.AlarmClockSpawnNonVR
member.summary: Transform to spawn the alarm clock at when not in VR mod. Best to ensure this is in view of the camera at all times.

member.name: F:KMGameplayRoom.AlarmClockSpawn
member.summary: Transform to spawn the alarm clock at when in VR.

member.name: F:KMGameplayRoom.BombPrefabOverride
member.summary: Use this if you want to specify a particular bomb to use in this room.

member.name: T:KMHighlightable
member.summary: Add this component to create a highlight at runtime based on this object's renderer.

member.name: F:KMHighlightable.HighlightScale
member.summary: Set this to non-zero to use a custom highlight scale. Otherwise, leave it at Vector3.zero for default scaling.

member.name: T:KMModSettings
member.summary: Interface to access the contents of the user settings stored in modSettings.json in the mod's directory. Useful for user-specific settings in a mod, such as configuring a Twitch account or anything else a user may tweak about a mod.

member.name: F:KMModSettings.Settings
member.summary: The contents of modSettings.json in this mod's directory, containing any user-specific data they may have put there.

member.name: F:KMModSettings.SettingsPath
member.summary: The location of the ModSettings file that can be used to refresh Settings without reloading the mod Set automatically by game overwriting anything that you put here

member.name: M:KMModSettings.RefreshSettings
member.summary: Refreshes settings from file, requires file access so good to use sparingly

member.name: T:KMModSettings.KMOnRefreshSettingsDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for refreshing settings

member.name: F:KMModSettings.OnRefreshSettings
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to refresh settings

member.name: T:KMModuleBacking
member.summary: Visual models of the foam behind modules. Modules that have holes or recesses can have parts of this visible.

member.name: F:KMModuleBacking.BackingDeep
member.summary: The visual model spawned when a module in this position has RequiresDeepBacking = true

member.name: F:KMModuleBacking.BackingNormal
member.summary: The visual model spawned when a module in this position has RequiresDeepBacking = false

member.name: T:KMRoom
member.summary: Generic room behaviour - use KMGameplayRoom or KMSetupRoom instead.

member.name: F:KMRoom.BombSpawnPosition
member.summary: Transform to spawn the bomb at.

member.name: F:KMRoom.PlayerSpawnPosition
member.summary: Transform to spawn the player at.

member.name: F:KMRoom.DossierSpawn
member.summary: Transform to spawn the Menu dossier at.

member.name: F:KMRoom.CameraAnimator
member.summary: The Animator used to move the camera from object to object when not using VR.

member.name: F:KMRoom.UseModQualitySettings
member.summary: Set this to true to enable realtime shadows at high quality.

member.name: F:KMRoom.HoldableSpawnPoints
member.summary: A list of transforms where mod holdables can be spawned

member.name: T:KMSelectable
member.summary: The interface to all interactive elements in the game. Set this up to allow an object to be selected, interacted with, and handle input.

member.name: T:KMSelectable.OnInteractHandler
member.summary: Delegate type for interactions, return is whether it should drill in to children

member.name: T:KMSelectable.OnCancelHandler
member.summary: Delegate type for cancelling, return is whether it should drill out to parent

member.name: F:KMSelectable.Parent
member.summary: The parent of this selectable

member.name: F:KMSelectable.Children
member.summary: This is the list of child selectables. Order is important as it is treated as a grid with row length defined by ChildRowLength.

member.name: F:KMSelectable.IsPassThrough
member.summary: Determines if this selectable is essentially a container, currently used for bomb faces

member.name: F:KMSelectable.ChildRowLength
member.summary: This is the number of selectables per row for gamepad controls

member.name: F:KMSelectable.Highlight
member.summary: Sets the object with a highlight mesh for this selectable

member.name: F:KMSelectable.SelectableColliders
member.summary: If you want to set the interaction colliders for mouse to something other than the highlight you can set them here.

member.name: F:KMSelectable.DefaultSelectableIndex
member.summary: Allows you to set a particular child as the default index for gamepad controls

member.name: F:KMSelectable.OnSelect
member.summary: Called whenever this selectable becomes the current selection

member.name: F:KMSelectable.OnDeselect
member.summary: Called whenever this selectable stops being the current selectable

member.name: F:KMSelectable.OnCancel
member.summary: Called when player backs out of this selectable, an example would be zooming out of a module

member.name: F:KMSelectable.OnInteract
member.summary: Called when player interacts with this selectable. Done on button down Returns whether or not it should try to drill to children

member.name: F:KMSelectable.OnInteractEnded
member.summary: Called when a player is interacting with this selectable and releases the mouse or controller button

member.name: F:KMSelectable.OnHighlight
member.summary: Called when the highlight is turned on, OnSelect is probably more appropriate for most things

member.name: F:KMSelectable.OnLeft
member.summary: Called when player pulls selection stick left while this selectable is focused

member.name: F:KMSelectable.OnRight
member.summary: Called when player pulls selection stick right while this selectable is focused

member.name: F:KMSelectable.AllowSelectionWrapX
member.summary: Determines whether gamepad selection should wrap around left/right

member.name: F:KMSelectable.AllowSelectionWrapY
member.summary: Determines whether gamepad selection should wrap around up/down

member.name: M:KMSelectable.AddInteractionPunch(System.Single)
member.summary: Adds bomb movement and controller vibration on interaction, amount is based on the modifier

member.name: M:KMSelectable.UpdateChildren(KMSelectable)
member.summary: Notifies the game that the children list has been updated Selects the child specified as the current selectable

member.name: F:KMSelectable.ForceSelectionHighlight
member.summary: Forces highlight to be selection highlight, this is yellow in game Should be used when interaction will drill down to child selectables

member.name: F:KMSelectable.ForceInteractionHighlight
member.summary: Forces highlight to be interaction highlight, this is red in game Should be used when interaction will trigger a behavior

member.name: T:KMSelectable.KMOnAddInteractionPunchDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for adding bomb movement and controller vibration on interaction

member.name: T:KMSelectable.KMOnUpdateChildrenDelegate
member.summary: Delegate type for updating the children map

member.name: F:KMSelectable.OnInteractionPunch
member.summary: DO NOT USE IN MOD. Used by the game to hook into the selectable.

member.name: T:KMService
member.summary: The base class for any mod behaviour you wish to have activated immediately and run indefinitely.

member.name: T:KMSetupRoom
member.summary: Add this component to a prefab to allow it to be used as a room during setup (e.g. the office with the bomb binder and freeplay device).

member.name: F:KMSetupRoom.FreeplayDeviceSpawn
member.summary: Transform at which the Freeplay Device should be spawned.

member.name: F:KMSetupRoom.BombBinderSpawn
member.summary: Transform at which the Bomb Binder should be spawned.

member.name: F:KMSetupRoom.ModManagerHoldableSpawn
member.summary: The spawn location for the mod manager holdable

member.name: T:KMSoundOverride
member.summary: Add this component to a prefab to specify an AudioClip that should be played whenever the given sound effect is triggered instead of the original game's audio.

member.name: F:KMSoundOverride.OverrideEffect
member.summary: The sound effect in the base game to replace.

member.name: F:KMSoundOverride.AudioClip
member.summary: The AudioClip to be played instead of the base game's sound.

member.name: F:KMSoundOverride.AdditionalVariants
member.summary: If you want to provide additional variants that will be chosen randomly to play for this override

member.name: T:KMHoldableSpawnPoint
member.summary: A class for specifying spawn points for holdable objects

member.name: F:KMHoldableSpawnPoint.SelectableIndexX
member.summary: The X position in the children map for the room, row lengths are 5

member.name: F:KMHoldableSpawnPoint.SelectableIndexY
member.summary: The Y position in the children map for this room, there are 4 rows in the selectable map
